content.question: When using a one-sample t-procedure to construct a confidence interval for the mean of a finite population, a condition is that the population size be at least 10 times the sample size. The reason for the condition is to ensure that

choices.label: the sample size is large enough
the central limit theorem is applicable for the sample mean
the sample standard deviation is a good approximation of the population standard deviation
the degree of dependence among observations is negligible
the sampling method is not biased

content.answer: the degree of dependence among observations is negligible

topic.text: 7.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Verify that inference procedures apply in a given situation.
